1:
A declaration about the desert by the sea.
\q1 Like stormwinds sweeping through the Negev it comes
\q1 passing through from the wilderness, from a terrible land.
\q1
2:
A distressing vision has been given to me:\q1 the treacherous man deals treacherously, and the destroyer destroys.
\q1 Go up and attack, Elam; besiege, Media;
\q1 I will stop all her groaning.


\q1
4:
My heart pounds, I shake with fear.\q1 Early evening, my favorite time of day, has brought me terror.


\q1
5:
They prepare the table, they spread rugs and eat and drink;\q1 arise, princes, anoint your shields with oil.


\q1
6:
For this is what the Lord said to me,\q1 "Go, post a watchman; he must report what he sees.
\q1
7:
When he sees a chariot, a pair of horsemen,\q1 riders on donkeys, and riders on camels,
\q1 then he must pay attention and be very alert."


\q1
8:
The watchman cries out,\f + \ft Instead of \fqa The watchman cries out \fqa* , some older versions have \fqa A lion cries out \fqa* . \f*
\q1 "Lord, on the watchtower I stand all day, every day,
\q1 and at my post I stand all night long."
\q1
9:
Here comes a chariot with a man and a pair of horsemen.\q1 He calls out, "Babylon has fallen, fallen,
\q1 and all the carved figures of its gods are broken to the ground."


\q1
10:
My threshed and winnowed ones, children of my threshing floor!\q1 What I have heard from Yahweh of hosts,
\q1 the God of Israel, I have declared to you.



\q1
11:
A declaration about Dumah.\q1 One calls to me from Seir, 
\q1 "Watchman, what is left of the night? 
\q1 Watchman, what is left of the night?"
\q1
12:
The watchman said, "The morning comes and also the night. \q1 If you want to ask, then ask; and come back again."


\q1
13:
A declaration about Arabia.
\q1 In the wilderness of Arabia you spend the night, you caravans of Dedanites.
\q1
14:
Bring water for the thirsty;\q1 inhabitants of the land of Tema, meet the fugitives with bread.
\q1
15: For they have fled from the sword, from the drawn sword,\q1 from the bent bow, and from the weight of war.
16: For this is what the Lord said to me, "Within a year, as a laborer hired for a year would see it, all the glory of Kedar will end.
17: Only a few of the archers, the warriors of Kedar will remain," for Yahweh, the God of Israel, has spoken.
